GO brothers !

- - - Updated - - -

how can it be on orbite after 3 minutes of launch ? O.O

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T00:07:25Z" title="04/27/2015 12:07  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by Vanamonde**
  
Language.
It isn't in orbit yet. Not by a long shot

Ah yes it still accelerating

But how can it get to 2000m/s that fast ? big launcher for a small probe that's it? 

Or their propellers are just much more efficient than kerbal ones ?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-27T00:05:21Z" title="04/27/2015 12:05  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 27, 2015</time> by Vanamonde**
  
Language.

a) this is the forum for Kerbal Space MARINES, the FPS. You want Kerbal Space PROGRAM for that sort of stuff.

![B)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_cool.png) The various space agencies around the world got together and uninstalled the RSS mod for real life. Earth is now 600km in radius - space is now affordable.

update:

c) 2km/s in 3 minutes is like 11m/s acceleration, or about 1.1g net average. That shouldn't be too hard in KSP, I'm probably averaging 1.5-2g overall with my own FAR-ish designs.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-26T20:13:25Z" title="04/26/2015 08:13  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 26, 2015</time> by Renegrade**

Already in orbit now, 8km/s.

how can it go that fast ... without timewarp of course ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
As this is not taking place within the game, it has been moved to Space Lounge. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
